features: Stand design is compatible with a variety of chassis and doesn’t occupy PCIe slots.
Offers a support height of 72-128 mm, delivering a strong, adaptable design.
An adjustable wheel and release button enable easy, toolless setup and removal.
Embedded 3D ARGB element is compatible with Aura Sync.
body.description: The ROG Herculx packs the structural integrity to bear the burden of even the heaviest graphics card. Toolless installation, precision adjustment, and customizable RGB lighting are combined into a space-saving design that neatly slides in to protect your investment in GPU horsepower.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Light Up Your Rig with ASUS ROG Herculx - A Game-Changer for Graphics Card Support!
reviews.reviewText: I recently got my hands on the ASUS ROG Herculx Graphics Card Anti-Sag Holder Bracket, and let me tell you, it's a total game-changer for my PC build! First off, the solid zinc alloy construction feels incredibly sturdy, giving me confidence that my pricey graphics card is in safe hands. The installation was a breeze – no tools needed, which is a big plus for someone like me who's not too handy with hardware.What really sets it apart is the included spirit level. It's such a small detail, but it made adjusting the height to perfectly align with my graphics card so easy. The wide compatibility means it fit my setup without any hassles, and I think it would work great for most PC builders out there.But here's the kicker – the Aura Sync RGB lighting. It adds such a cool vibe to my setup, especially when I'm gaming in the dark. It's not just functional, but also adds an aesthetic appeal to my rig.So, if you're looking to give your graphics card the support it deserves while adding some flair to your setup, I'd definitely recommend the ASUS ROG Herculx. It's a small investment for a big upgrade in both functionality and style! And who doesn't loves a bit of RGB in their life, right?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent video card stand with Rgb
reviews.reviewText: This stand is very sturdy and feels well made. It goes very well with my ASUS motherboard and graphics card. I like the fact that it’s rgb and is compatible with the signalrgb software. I have a 4070ti which is massive, and this stand supports it nicely. Thank you ASUS for another great product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It Has 17 LEDS and looks great
reviews.reviewText: This product went Stright under my gpu and the built in level is removable and magnetic so it will stick to the gpu until you get it leveled then go right back on the base. this things looks awesome and works great, the only complaint i had was that the weight distribution from where the extendable arm is causes a pivot point at the very rear of the foot and the slightest bump after you install it and it will move and through your aesthetics off, once i upgraded cases i no longer needed this and i actually still use it for decoration in my case and it looks great,. quality is magnificent as well, if you can find one for 25$ like new used like i did then you have found a wonderful deal and need to jump on it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Easy to install. ROG worked well even with my msi board / software. Looks legit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cool but ridiculous
reviews.reviewText: The herculx by Asus ROG is a cool, helpful, but ridiculous product.It's very useful for propping up these massive new RTX 30 series and later cards, which I just bought for myself after using a gtx 1000 series for many years. Though for me this was very much optional as I have an Asus ROG Strix motherboard which has reinforced anti-sag PCIe ports. However I like to baby my electronics, so I got this anyways.If you're like me and you are a big gamer, and love all the fancy RGB stuff, and gaming knick-knacks, then you'll love this. If you also don't have a reinforced motherboard, you'll definitely need this as the RTX 30 series are huge cards, they feel like something that belongs in a vehicle engine rather than a PC part.The herculx is a very well engineered device. It has a small little "foot" on it which can be dialed to adjust the height down to the millimeter. It's got a push-button that allows you to manually adjust the height in bigger volumes so you don't have to sit there and turn the dial forever, it fits a wide variety of spaces so it should work with most cases/PC setups, however keep in mind your measurements and spacing just in case.I call the herculx ridiculous because it's so over the top, it's got RGB lighting of course which plugs into an addressable RGB header on your motherboard, and can be setup just like any other RGB peripheral device. The colors are also very vibrant and the device has this "holographic" look to it which is really cool.This thing also has a detachable, magnetic level that fits right on it for storage which is another reason I call it ridiculous, however it is still very useful if you're paranoid about your card sagging.The one down side to a GPU stand like this is that GPUs aren't exactly designed for stands. I say that because GPUs tend to have a lot of fans, and you have to be careful not to place the stand touching one of these fans or you may damage your GPU. In fact I bought a ROG Strix brand RTX 30 series card and I found very little spaces for the stand's little "foot" to sit under, I had to place it in a tiny little space along the edge of the card between two of the fans in order for it to hold the card, but also be out of the way.TL;DR This is a great item, and it'll hold a GPU up for sure, it's well engineered and is very smooth operating, it has RGB via an addressable header plug (3 prong) and even comes with a magnetic, detachable level. It's got a cool holographic style face to it which makes the lighting look super cool. And lastly it is covered in ROG branding so you can show off your ROG dedication.I wouldn't recommend this to just anyone, however I WOULD 100% recommend this to someone who has the money for it, and needs to prop up their GPU to prevent sagging/damage to their motherboard. It's a great product and though at the time of me buying this it was $40USD, I would probably buy it again, there are cheaper GPU stands out there, but this one is so well made it just screams quality. Even the packaging was incredible.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars ROG Products are the best!!
reviews.reviewText: Great cost, and super easy installation!!
Es excelente y práctico, es fácil de instalar y muy difícilmente se mueve una ves que queda bien fijo. El precio no me convencía pero después de encender la PC mis dudas se esfumaron.

The media could not be loaded. my GOD is this thing well made and absolutely GORGEOUS, my phone camera can't capture it properly. the way the careful machining of the metal catches the light at different angles is incredible, it's like it's shimmering. i often catch myself staring at it when im not engrossed in art or a game...
Won't hold all GPU's as the fans on the bottom leave you with little space to make contact with it. Looks great though, which is why I got it anyway.
Cumple su función y tiene muy buena estética como todos los productos de ROG. Perfecta para mi RTX4060.

The media could not be loaded. In fact, it looks so good that even though it doesn't fit with my ASUS z790 motherboard because this design of motherboard moves the video card down one slot to put in an extra M2 card slot, I'm keeping it. There's like a little part on the back of it that is slightly holding the corner of my video card. Just enough to say that it's being held so I think that's good enough for me. I could see how where the proper install it would really look great but unfortunately doesn't work quite right with my system. I'm still going to give it five stars though cuz I see the potential and it looks amazing.
